destinations.name: Cox's Bazar
destinations.description: Famous for its long sandy beach, the world's longest natural beach.

destinations.name: Sundarbans
destinations.description: The world's largest mangrove forest and home to the Royal Bengal Tiger.

destinations.name: Srimangal
destinations.description: Known as the tea capital of Bangladesh, famous for its tea plantations and scenic landscapes.

destinations.name: Dhaka
destinations.description: The capital city of Bangladesh, famous for its historical sites, museums, and vibrant culture.

destinations.name: Sylhet
destinations.description: Famous for its natural beauty, tea gardens, and the shrine of the famous Sufi saint Hazrat Shah Jalal.

destinations.name: Chittagong
destinations.description: The second-largest city in Bangladesh, known for its beaches, hills, and ship-breaking yards.

destinations.name: Kuakata
destinations.description: A popular beach town known for its panoramic sea views and beautiful sunsets.

destinations.name: Rangamati
destinations.description: A hill district in the southeast of Bangladesh, famous for its scenic beauty and diverse tribal cultures.

destinations.name: Paharpur
destinations.description: A UNESCO World Heritage site and the ruins of an ancient Buddhist monastery.

destinations.name: Bagerhat
destinations.description: A historic town known for its mosques, including the UNESCO-listed Sixty Dome Mosque.
